edu.up.cs301.game.util
Class IPCoder

java.lang.Object
  edu.up.cs301.game.util.IPCoder

public class IPCoder
extends java.lang.Object

Helper-class to encode and decode IP addresses to/from a format that is convenient for typing on an Android soft keyboard.

Version:
July 2013
Author:
Steven R. Vegdahl

Constructor Detail

IPCoder

public IPCoder()
Method Detail

getLocalIpAddress

public static java.lang.String getLocalIpAddress()
gets the IP address of the current device

Returns:
the IP address of the current device, or and error message if an IP address cannot be determined

getLocalIpAddressAsNumber

public static long getLocalIpAddressAsNumber()
returns address of the current device as a 64-bit non-negative number

Returns:
a long value that represents the current IP address as an integer, or -1 if the IP address could not be determined

encodeLocalIP

public static java.lang.String encodeLocalIP()
Encodes the local IP address as base-36 number, converted to a string

Returns:
the encoded number-string, or "*invalid*" if the conversion could not be done

decodeIp

public static java.lang.String decodeIp(java.lang.String codedIp)
decode the IP address back into a well-formed IP string (i.e., with periods and digits

Parameters:
codedIp - the IP code to decode
Returns:
the decoded IP, or "*invalid*" if not a valid coded (or already decoded) IP code
